[TITLE]
<line: 27> NOTICE OF REMOYAL OF CAUSE

[TITLE]
<line: 29> LFILED
<line: 30> To:
<line: 31> Attorney for Plaintif!
<line: 32> David L. Goldberg
<line: 33> 120 West Madison Street.
<line: 34> APR 2 9 2008
<line: 35> Suite 400
<line: 36> Apr 29 2000
<line: 37> Chicago, Illinois 60602.
<line: 38> MICHAEL W. DOBeIN$
<line: 39> 312-327-1840)
<line: 40> CLERK, U.S. DISTRICT COURT
<line: 41> Defendant Petcr J. DiAngi (Defendant),pursuant to 28 U.S.(:. $ 1446 (b) and the Iocal
<line: 42> Rules of the United States District Court, Northern District of Hlinois, notifies this Honorable
<line: 43> Court that the above-entitled cause has been removed from the Cireuit Court of Cook County,.
<line: 44> Ilinois, and in support of said notice states as follows.

[TEXT]
<line: 46> 1.
<line: 47> The Summons and Complaint in this matter were served on April 4, 2008. The.
<line: 48> Complaint seeks damages based on Peter J. DiAngi's alleged violation of 42 UJ.S.C. s 1983.
<line: 49> (herein attached as Exhibit "A)

[TEXT]
<line: 51> 2.
<line: 52> Defendant denics that it is liable to Plaintiff for any of the reliet sought in their.
<line: 53> Complaint.

[TEXT]
<line: 55> 3.
<line: 56> This Court has original jurisdiction over Plaintiff's cause of action as it is brought
<line: 57> undcr 42 U.S.C.$ 1983 and involves a federal yuestion as sct forth in 28 UJ.S.C. $ 1331. Pursuant

[TEXT]
<line: 59> 484092.1

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430
<line: 3> Document 1
<line: 4> Filed 04/29/2008
<line: 5> Page 2 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 7> to 28 U.S.C. 85 1441 and 1443, thcrefore, the civil action pending in thc Circuit Court of Cook
<line: 8> County is removable to this Court.

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 4.
<line: 11> Venue is proper in this Court since this United States Northern District Court.
<line: 12> cmbraccs the County ot Cook, State of llinois in which the action is prcsently pending.

[TEXT]
<line: 14> 5.
<line: 15> The Defendant is, therefore, cntitied to remove this action to this Court pursuant
<line: 16> to 28 U.S.C. $$$1331, 1441, 1443 and Plaintiff's Complaint is removable on its face..

[TEXT]
<line: 18> 6.
<line: 19> In compliance with 28 UJ.S.C. $1446(b), this Notice of Removal is filed with this
<line: 20> Court within thirty (30) days after receipt of a copy of the initial pleading setting forth the claim
<line: 21> for relief upon which this action or proceeding is based and within thirty (30) days aftcr scrvice
<line: 22> ol summons.

[TEXT]
<line: 24> WHEREFoRE, Defendant P'eter J. DiAngi, notifies that this cause has been removed
<line: 25> from the Circuit Court of Cook County, llinois, Law Division, to the United Statcs District
<line: 26> Court for the Northem District of lllinois, Eastern Division, pursuant to the provisions of 28
<line: 27> UJ.S.C. $1446 and the Local Rules of the United States District Court tor the Northem District of
<line: 28> llinois.

[TEXT]
<line: 30> Respectfully submitted,

[TITLE]
<line: 32> PETER J. DIANGI

[TEXT]

<line: 47> TERRELL were residents of the County of Cook and State of llinois.

<line: 51> thu County of Cook and $tate of Illinois..

<line: 20> the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, a8 a police officer.

[TEXT]
<line: 22> $.

<line: 24> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club
<line: 25> and located at 14700 South 82rd Avenue in tho City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State
<line: 26> of lllinois.

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 6.
<line: 29> On or about March 182006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiance
<line: 30> were marritd at Queen of Marturs Church in Evergreen Park. Immcdiately after the wedding
<line: 31> ceremony, thc Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fjance, and various other members of the
<line: 32> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reccption at
<line: 33> $ilver Lake Country Club.

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 7.
<line: 36> The Defendant, PEIER DIANGl, grabbed the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL,
<line: 37> by the arin.

[TEXT]

<line: 41> DIANGI, did not identify himsolf as a security guard or otber employce of SIL,VER LAKE, nor
<line: 42> did he identify himself as a police officer..

<line: 44> 9.

<line: 46> PETER DIANGI, grabbed ANDREW TERRELL by thc neck. A melee ensued as wedding
<line: 47> gue$t$ attempted tw defend the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL

[TITLE]
<line: 30> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter Diangi )

[TEXT]

<line: 33> FACTUAL ALLEGtATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of Count I, s though
<line: 34> fully set forth hercin and incorporate the same by reference.

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 14.

<line: 38> I'HRReLL, was intentional, malicious, cxcessive and in reckless disregard of thc Plaintiffs'.
<line: 39> constitutional rights. Moreover, the use of force nsed against the Plaintiff was excessive.

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 15.
<line: 42> As a result of thc aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintitl suffered
<line: 43> serious physical injuries. Plaintiff also incurred tnedioal expenses and other damages, including.
<line: 44> physical and emotional pain and suffering.

[TEXT]
<line: 46> 16.
<line: 47> The Plaintiff's injuries were the proximate result of Defendant's aforementioned.
<line: 48> conduct.

[TEXT]
<line: 50> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully tequests judgment.
<line: 51> aganst thc Defendant, PETER DIANGI, jn a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND

<line: 16> of immediate and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and ht suffered great shame and.

<line: 18> psychologically.

<line: 24> COUNT III - BATTERY

[TITLE]
<line: 26> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake).

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 1. through 13. Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inchusive of the COMMON
<line: 29> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of Count II, as though
<line: 30> Mlly set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference..

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 14. Thc conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI toward the Plaintiff, ANDREW
<line: 33> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious and excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs'
<line: 34> constitutional rights. Morcover, the use of foroe used against the Plaintiff was excessive.

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 15.
<line: 37> At all times relevant herein the Deftndant, PETeR DIANGI, was engaged in his.
<line: 38> ordinary duties as a security guard and employee, agent, apparent agent, and/or servant of thc.
<line: 39> Defendant, SILVER LAKF.

<line: 11> 17.

<line: 13> mace was unjustified and excessive.

[TEXT]

<line: 17> serious injuries. Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical
<line: 18> and emotional pain and suffering.

[TEXT]
<line: 28> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRBLL, respectfnlly tequests judgment
<line: 29> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100
<line: 30> DOLLARS ($s0,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate.

<line: 24> COUNT XVII - WILLFUL & WANTON

[ISOLATE_FORMULA]
<line: 26> (George Terrell v, Orland Park)

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 1. through 13. Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON.
<line: 29> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of Count XVII, as
<line: 30> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by referenco..

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 14.
<line: 33> Pursuant to 745 ILCS 10/2-202, municipalities are liable for injuries resulting.
<line: 34> from willful and wanton acts or omissions of police officers while engaged in the execntion or
<line: 35> enforcenent of the Jaw.

[TEXT]
<line: 37> 15.
<line: 38> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1  13, PETER DIANGI knew that the.
<line: 39> Plaintiff, GEORGh TERRELL, was lawfully upon the prenises of Sjlver Lake Country Ciub.

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 16.
<line: 42> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1  13, PETER DIANGI was cngaged in the
<line: 43> execution or enforcement of the law on behalf when he grabbed and/or struck the Plaintiff,
<line: 44> GEORGE TERRELL. Moreover, PETER DIANGI engaged in willfl and wanton conduct

[TITLE]
<line: 28> (George Terrell)

[TEXT]

<line: 32> though fuJly set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 13.
<line: 35>  At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 - 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the
<line: 36> Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, was Iegally upon the premises of SiJver Lake Country Club.

[TEXT]

<line: 39> At all times set forth in paragraphs I - 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the
<line: 40> execution or enforcenent of the law, and was acting under the color of authority when he.
<line: 41> engaged in the conduct alleged herein, and when he arrested the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL.

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 15.
<line: 8> The conduct engaged in by GEORGh TERRELL was intentional, malicious, and.
<line: 9> with deliberate indifference to the Plaintiff's rights under the Constitution.

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 16.
<line: 12> The conduct of the Defendants deprived thc Plaintiff of the following rights,
<line: 13> .. privileges, and immunities secured to him by the Constitution of the United States:.

[TEXT]
<line: 15> a.
<line: 16> The right of plaintiff to bo secure in his person and cffects against
<line: 17> unreasonable scaroh and seizure under the Fourth and Fouteenth Amendments to the
<line: 18> Constitution of the United States (Art. IV, U.S. Constitution, Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution.); and
<line: 19> b.
<line: 20> The tight of Plaintiff not to be deprived of life, liberty, or property without
<line: 21> due process of law, and the right to the equal protection of the laws, secured by the Fourteenth
<line: 22> Amendment of the Constitution of the United States (Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution)..

[TEXT]
<line: 24> 17.
<line: 25>  Prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to properly train and supervise
<line: 26> its officer's, including, but not limnited to GEORGE TERRELI. regarding proper procedures to be
<line: 27> used in apprehending a suspect, including the proper use of force.

[TEXT]
<line: 29> 18.
<line: 30> In addition, prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to discipline its
<line: 31> officers. including, but not limited to PETER DIANGl, following excessive use of force by
<line: 32> police such that its officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI, were led to believe.
<line: 33> that the consequences of failing to follow proper procedure in the exercise of force were minimal.
<line: 34> or nonexistent.

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 19.
<line: 37> As a result of the failure of ORLAND PARK to properly train, supervise and.
<line: 38> discipline its officers, inoluding, but not limited to OF PETER DLANGI, the Plaintiff suffered
<line: 39> serious injuries. Plaintitf also incurred medical expenses and other danages, including physical
<line: 40> and emotional pain and suffering.
